gov.anl.ipns.ViewTools.Components.ViewControls
Class CheckedControl

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          javax.swing.JComponent
              javax.swing.JPanel
                  gov.anl.ipns.ViewTools.UI.ActiveJPanel
                      gov.anl.ipns.ViewTools.Components.ViewControls.ViewControl
                          gov.anl.ipns.ViewTools.Components.ViewControls.CheckedControl
All Implemented Interfaces:
IPreserveState, IViewControl, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible
Direct Known Subclasses:
ControlCheckboxCombobox, ControlCheckboxSpinner
public class CheckedControl
extends ViewControl

This is a ViewControl that has a checkbox, label, and another "sub" ViewControl placed side-by-side. When, the checkbox is checked/unchecked the sub ViewControl is enabled/disabled.

This control is designed to be used by components that have certain functionality that is only available if the user selects to have the functionality available. In this case, the user would check the checkbox, and the ViewControl to control the component's functionality would be enabled. Otherwise, the ViewControl would be disabled because it would not be applicable.

See Also:
Serialized Form

Field Detail

CHECKBOX_STATE_KEY

public static final java.lang.String CHECKBOX_STATE_KEY
"Checkbox state key" - This static constant String is the key used for referencing the state information about the checkbox on this control. The value that this key references is an ObjectState.

See Also:

SUBCONTROL_STATE_KEY

public static final java.lang.String SUBCONTROL_STATE_KEY
"Subcontrol state key" - This static constant String is the key used for referencing the state information about the sub-ViewControl placed on this control. The value that this key references is an ObjectState.

Constant Field Values
Constructor Detail

CheckedControl

public CheckedControl(java.lang.String con_title,
                      boolean isChecked,
                      java.lang.String label,
                      ViewControl subControl)
Creates this ViewControl with the given title. The layout of the control is that it has a checkbox, a label, and another ViewControl all lined up horizontally.

Parameters:
con_title - The control's title.
isChecked - True if the checkbox on this control should be checked and false if it shouldn't be.
label - The text of the label that is on this control. If this value is null, the label is not placed on the control.
subControl - The other ViewControl to place on this control.

CheckedControl

public CheckedControl(boolean isChecked,
                      ViewControl subControl)
Creates this ViewControl with an empty title. The layout of the control is that it has a checkbox another ViewControl lined up horizontally. The control has "" set as its title and doesn't have a label.

Parameters:
isChecked - True if the checkbox on this control should be checked and false if it shouldn't be.
subControl - The other ViewControl to place on this control.
